wikipedia_page.main: Andrew Patterson (born 4 September 1975) is a former Irish and Sussex cricketer, who now works as a PE teacher.

response: *Andrew Patterson (Patterson), fictional academic in UK radio series Patterson

After leaving Glamorgan, Solanky spent a year as a cricket coach and squash professional in South Wales before moving to Northern Ireland in 1980. He played for and coached Lisburn Cricket Club and Cliftonville Cricket Club, coaching future Ireland internationals such as Kyle McCallan, Andrew Patterson and Mark Patterson.
*Andrew Patterson (Patterson), fictional academic, central character of British radio series Patterson
* [Andrew Patterson]- born 1989. Former world number 1 Water-Slider and current teacher

link_mentions.page: List of Bedfordshire County Cricket Club List A players
response: | Andrew Patterson || 2003 || 1 || Made nine Minor Counties Championship appearances for Bedfordshire between 2002 and 2004, having previously played first-class cricket for Ireland and Sussex. Brother of Mark Patterson. || Andrew Patterson, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2019-08-14.

| Mark Patterson || 2002–2005 || 3 || Played for Bedfordshire between 2002 and 2005, making a total of 22 Minor Counties Championship appearances. Had previously played briefly for Surrey and made other List A appearances for Ireland in ICC Trophy matches. Brother of Andrew Patterson. || Mark Patterson, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2019-08-14.
